body.name: Foille Medicated First Aid Ointment, 1 Ounce (Pack of 6)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Saturday, February 17. Order within 12 hrs 1 min
features: Foille Medicated First Aid Ointment 1 oz.
Temporary relief of pain due to minor injuries (scrapes, cuts, minor burns, etc.)
Formula contains an external analgesic (benzocaine 5.0%) and an antiseptic (chloroxylenol 0.1%) to relieve pain, help heal, and prevent infection
body.description: Foille Medicated First Aid Ointment provides temporary relief of pain due to scrapes, cuts, minor burns, sunburn, non-poisonous insect bites, and minor skin irritation. Its medicated corn oil-based formula contains an external analgesic (benzocaine 5.0%) and an antiseptic (chloroxylenol 0.1%) to help heal and prevent infection in minor cuts, scrapes and burns. Foille stops pain on contact and allows you to resume normal activities right way!

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #128,699 in Health & Household (See Top 100 in Health & Household) #475 in First Aid Ointments

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best burn cream in the universe! Like having God in a tube! Seriously
reviews.reviewText: When you burn yourself, and I mean really burn yourself, grab a tube of this stuff, apply a thick coating over the burn, then cover the burn with something that will keep the ointment on your burn, if on your arm, wrap your arm in plastic wrap, finger, put on a plastic glove, cover your burn with something that will not allow this stuff to be soaked up, but stay on the burn. Wait 12 to 24 hours, the worse the burn the longer you keep it covered. I burned my whole hand one time from a radiator cap that blew off because the engine was very overheated, probably 300 degrees, the top of my hand was on fire literally that is what it felt like, I took a plastic glove, put ointment in each finger in the glove, then covered my hand with the ointment, used the whole tube, put the glove on my hand and 24 hours later I removed it! My hand was normal, no blisters, no redness, no nothing but a normal hand. I have burned myself in the kitchen, a finger, really bad, apply ointment, put glove on, till the morning, remove glove, nothing, no blisters, no nothing. Best Burn Ointment in the Universe. Nothing Better!!!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This should be in ALL first aid kits!
reviews.reviewText: This is the BEST burn ointment on the planet. I have used this brand for decades and I recommend everyone have this product in their home first aid kits.⛑

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best treatment for burns and minor skin irritations!
reviews.reviewText: Foille is a decades old proven treatment for burns and bug bites or skin irritations. It will take the pain out of a burn in 15 minutes or less. One day I gave a tube to a mom whose daughter had a rash on her neck from some dye in her shirt. 20 minutes later the red was gone from her neck and her daughter was running around playing. I have been using it for at least 40 years and it was not new when my mother-in-law recommended it to me. I have given dozens of tubes away because it is no longer available in the stores and Blistex does not advertise it. I am just glad it is still available to purchase. It can be ordered through your local pharmacy or from Amazon. I buy six tubes at a time!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Product Ever!
reviews.reviewText: This is the greatest product ever! I have been using it for over 50 years! It works on cuts and scrapes, but what it does for burns is nothing short of miraculous! My son is a chef, and he keeps it on hand! My only complaint is that they no longer make the spray, which was wonderful to have for sunburns! If you have kids, you are going to want to have this in your first aid kit! I do recommend that if you are using it on a place that you can't cover with a band-aid, use a dedicated shirt or bottom as this can stain. But I can live with the stains not to have pain or scars!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome first aide
reviews.reviewText: My family has been using this medicine as first aide for minor burns, skin irritations and some kinds of bug bites since the 1960s. Now that I can’t find it in the drug stores here anymore I’m so grateful that it’s available on Amazon. I always buy the multi pack because I frequently give it away to others who’ve never had the good fortune to use it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Have used this before
reviews.reviewText: I use this for most everything with broken skin, rash etc. Have used it for many years and used to be able to buy in the drug stores but they no longer keep it in stock. "Wonderful for burns in the kitchen etc - if I get it on right away - it will keep the skin from burning and prevent the pain. I keep some in the kitchen, bathroom etc. so I can grab it at a moments notice. So glad to be able to still obtain this on line - it is an "old" product that probably doesn't bring a lot of income to the company but is really a tried and true helper. Jean Post

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A very good medication product.
reviews.reviewText: Have used it before to sooth and heat insect bites and also to treat minor burns and abrasions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best burn medication ever.
reviews.reviewText: I have is in my first aid kit and have for 40 years. I have burned myself terribly on the grill and from fireworks and would have definitely blistered had I not immediately applied Foile. Best burn medication out there.
